The Winnipeg Free Press was always read in our house, but we also subscribed to the Omaha World-Herald, the Chicago Tribune, and the New York Times.

We also subscribed to the Christian Science Monitor and the Wall Street Journal.

59. How large a part did singing and other forms of music play in your home entertainment in early years in the West? Describe.

We sang Sunday morning and the night before we went on our way. We had a wonderful custom by 1914 nearly every home had organs or pianos and harmony singing was common in the community. There were there musical concerts, parties, etc., describe. Thus was a lot of singing from the start. We always had Amish who came from Pennsylvania.

60. What were some of the favorite songs in the homes?

Mary O'Malley, Hillbilly Blues, Annie Laurie, The Holy City, The Star Spangled Banner, The Boar's Head Carol, The Holy City, and dozens more.
